title: AGENTS.md
text: Package name: ellmer.extensions Groq provider support (chat_groq_developer, ProviderGroqDeveloper) Gemini file-based batch support (chat_gemini_extended, ProviderGeminiExtended) Origin: Cloned groqDeveloper adapted Gemini batch functionality. See CLAUDE.md full architecture design details.

title: AGENTS.md
text: S7 provider classes created dynamically .onLoad (extend ellmer parent classes) ProviderGroqDeveloper extends ProviderOpenAICompatible (Chat Completions format) ProviderGeminiExtended extends ProviderGoogleGemini use register_*_methods() + S7::methods_register() ellmer internals accessed via asNamespace("ellmer") throughout %||% imported rlang

title: AGENTS.md
text: Groq: GROQ_API_KEY Gemini: GEMINI_API_KEY (GOOGLE_API_KEY) Keep .Renviron local ; commit . .Renviron.example contains placeholder values .

title: AGENTS.md
text: Run package root: Rscript -e "devtools::document()" Rscript -e "devtools::test()" Rscript -e "devtools::lint()" (run end) Rscript -e "devtools::check()"

title: AGENTS.md
text: Groq unit tests run offline dummy credentials. Groq integration tests require GROQ_API_KEY. Gemini unit tests run offline; cover helper functions (gemini_extract_index, gemini_json_fallback, gemini_normalize_result, gemini_prepare_batch_body). Gemini integration tests require GEMINI_API_KEY GOOGLE_API_KEY; poll bounded timeout skip batch finish. Gemini batch_chat_structured may return HTTP 400 models; test skips gracefully. Linting via .lintr: line_length_linter(120), S7 PascalCase names suppressed.

title: AGENTS.md
text: R-CMD-check: .github/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml (push main/master, PRs) pkgdown: .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml

title: AGENTS.md
text: .Renviron gitignored purged git history. data-raw/ gitignored (development scripts ). docs/ gitignored (built CI via pkgdown). secret ever pushed shared, rotate keys immediately.

title: AGENTS.md
text: ProviderGeminiExtended exported design (use chat_gemini_extended()). Groq structured outputs: streaming tool use support. Gemini batch jobs can remain queued extended periods. .onLoad uses separate tryCatch(suppressMessages(...)) blocks per provider; one failing doesn’t block . Heavy reliance asNamespace("ellmer") internals – fragile ellmer changes. S7 subclassing segfaults Windows R 4.5.1 outside .onLoad; defensive re-registration needed. S7::method<- prints “Overwriting method” messages; registration wrapped suppressMessages(). Gemini batch_retrieve checks multiple paths responsesFile (API structure varies). lifecycle Suggests; used roxygen badge macros doc-gen time.

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Package name: ellmer.extensions Groq provider support (chat_groq_developer, ProviderGroqDeveloper) Gemini file-based batch support (chat_gemini_extended, ProviderGeminiExtended) Origin: Cloned groqDeveloper adapted Gemini batch functionality.

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: provider classes created dynamically .onLoad (R/provider-groq.R) extend ellmer classes aren’t available package build time: ProviderGroqDeveloper extends ellmer::ProviderOpenAICompatible (Chat Completions API format) ProviderGeminiExtended extends ellmer::ProviderGoogleGemini Method registration uses S7::method() calls inside register_groq_methods() register_gemini_methods(), followed S7::methods_register(). provider’s class creation method registration wrapped tryCatch(suppressMessages(...)) block failure one provider prevent initializing.

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Uses OpenAI Chat Completions API format (via ProviderOpenAICompatible) Schema override adds additionalProperties: false recursively Groq’s strict JSON validation Batch API: upload JSONL -> create batch job -> poll -> download results Batch processing 50% cost discount, completion window 24h (usually seconds)

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Use bare segment names httr2::req_url_path_append() — leading slashes. Leading slashes produce double-slash paths (e.g. //files//id//content) may break strict routers.
code: # GOOD req_url_path_append(req, "files", id, "content")  # BAD — produces double slashes req_url_path_append(req, "/files/", id, "/content")

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Upload JSONL input file via google_upload_init / google_upload_send / google_upload_wait Submit models/{model}:batchGenerateContent Poll batch operation Download output file via files/*:download (requires ?alt=media query parameter) line must {"key": "string", "request": {GenerateContentRequest}} field names must snake_case (protobuf field names), camelCase. ellmer::chat_body() returns camelCase (generationConfig, systemInstruction, etc.) gemini_prepare_batch_body() converts . Exception: user-defined schema property names preserved -(schema subtree saved conversion restored ). Structured output field response_json_schema, response_schema (REST API accepts either; batch parser accepts newer name). Empty system_instruction blocks (e.g. {"parts": {"text": ""}}) rejected; gemini_prepare_batch_body() strips . Plain GenerateContentResponse lines Wrapped response/error/status variants Batch method registration done .onLoad, defensive re-registration chat_gemini_extended() support devtools::load_all() workflows. batch_retrieve checks multiple paths responsesFile (response$output$responsesFile, response$responsesFile, metadata$output$responsesFile) Gemini API response structure varies API versions. 50% cost discount, target 24-hour turnaround, 2 GB max file size, 48-hour expiry Structured output via batch_chat_structured() may supported Gemini models (HTTP 400); integration tests handle gracefully

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Groq: GROQ_API_KEY Gemini: GEMINI_API_KEY (GOOGLE_API_KEY) Keep .Renviron local ; never commit .Renviron.example contains placeholder values

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Run package root: Rscript -e "devtools::document()" Rscript -e "devtools::test()" Rscript -e "devtools::lint()" (run end) Rscript -e "devtools::check()"

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Groq unit tests (test-provider-groq.R): Run offline dummy credentials; test class structure, schema generation, batch support flags. Groq integration tests (test-api-integration.R): Require GROQ_API_KEY; test live chat, structured output, batch processing. Gemini unit tests (test-provider-gemini.R): Run offline; test class structure, batch support, helper functions (gemini_extract_index, gemini_json_fallback, gemini_normalize_result). Gemini integration tests (test-gemini-batch-integration.R): Require GEMINI_API_KEY GOOGLE_API_KEY; poll bounded timeout (120s) skip batch finish. skip expected behavior queue pressure. Linting configured via .lintr line_length_linter(120), object_name_linter = NULL (S7 PascalCase), object_length_linter = NULL.

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: .Renviron gitignored purged git history. .Renviron accidentally committed, remove tracking immediately follow purge procedure AGENTS.md. secret ever pushed shared, rotate keys immediately.

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: ProviderGeminiExtended exported (design; users use chat_gemini_extended()). Groq structured outputs support streaming tool use. Gemini batch jobs can remain queued extended periods; integration tests handle gracefully. .onLoad error handlers silently defer initialization failures (needed documentation builds); users see informative errors try use provider functions. Heavy reliance asNamespace("ellmer") internal functions – fragile ellmer renames internals. S7 segfault Windows R 4.5.1: Creating S7 subclasses ellmer providers (S7::new_class(parent = ProviderGoogleGemini)) segfaults called outside .onLoad context. also affects S7::method<- register_gemini_methods() post-load. classes work correctly created .onLoad. chat_gemini_extended() defensive register_gemini_methods() call, has_batch_support test also re-registers defensively. S7::method<- prints “Overwriting method” messages R CMD check treats unsuppressable startup messages. registration calls must wrapped suppressMessages(). lifecycle Suggests, Imports (used roxygen doc-gen time badge macros).

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: Core: ellmer, S7, purrr, cli, httr2, curl, withr, jsonlite, rlang Suggests: testthat, lifecycle

title: CLAUDE.md - ellmer.extensions
text: GitHub repo: https://github.com/xmarquez/ellmer.extensions pkgdown site: https://xmarquez.github.io/ellmer.extensions/ R-CMD-check: .github/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml (push main/master, PRs) pkgdown: .github/workflows/pkgdown.yaml

title: Authors and Citation
text: Xavier Marquez. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marquez X (2026). ellmer.extensions: Groq Gemini Provider Extensions ellmer. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/xmarquez/ellmer.extensions.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ellmer.extensions: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer},   author = {Xavier Marquez},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/xmarquez/ellmer.extensions}, }

what: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: ellmer.extensions extends ellmer : chat_groq_developer() Groq structured outputs Groq batch support. chat_gemini_extended() Gemini chat plus file-based batch support. package fully integrated ellmer generics like batch_chat(), batch_chat_structured(), parallel_chat(), etc. need paid Groq developer account Groq batch processing, Gemini API key Gemini batch processing.

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: can install development version ellmer.extensions GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("xmarquez/ellmer.extensions")

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: Set one provider keys .Renviron (edit usethis::edit_r_environ()): (GOOGLE_API_KEY also works Gemini.)
code: GROQ_API_KEY=your-groq-key GEMINI_API_KEY=your-gemini-key

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
code: library(ellmer.extensions)  chat_groq <- chat_groq_developer(model = "openai/gpt-oss-20b") chat_groq$chat("What is the capital of France?")

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
code: library(ellmer.extensions)  chat_gemini <- chat_gemini_extended(model = "gemini-2.5-flash") chat_gemini$chat("Reply with exactly one word: hello")

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
code: type_person <- ellmer::type_object(   name = ellmer::type_string(),   age = ellmer::type_integer(),   city = ellmer::type_string() )  result <- chat_groq$chat_structured(   "John is 30 years old and lives in New York City",   type = type_person )  str(result)

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: Process multiple requests cost savings using Groq’s batch API. Groq batch API typically blazingly fast; though completion guaranteed least 24 hours, requests 500 prompts finish seconds.
code: prompts <- list(   "What is 2 + 2? Reply with only the number.",   "What is the capital of New Zealand? Reply with only the city." )  path <- tempfile(fileext = ".json")  chats <- batch_chat(   chat_groq,   prompts = prompts,   path = path,   wait = TRUE )  chats

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
code: type_answer <- ellmer::type_object(   question = ellmer::type_string(),   answer = ellmer::type_string() )  path <- tempfile(fileext = ".json")  data <- batch_chat_structured(   chat_groq,   prompts = list("What is 2+2?", "What is the capital of France?"),   path = path,   type = type_answer )  data

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: Gemini batch processing uses file-based Batch API. Requests uploaded JSONL file, processed asynchronously 50% standard pricing, target 24-hour turnaround (many jobs complete faster). Maximum input file size 2 GB.
code: prompts <- list(   "Reply with exactly: ok",   "Reply with exactly: done" )  path <- tempfile(fileext = ".json")  # Submit without waiting, then resume later batch_chat(   chat_gemini,   prompts = prompts,   path = path,   wait = FALSE )  batch_chat_completed(chat_gemini, prompts, path)  # Resume and retrieve once completed chats <- batch_chat(   chat_gemini,   prompts = prompts,   path = path,   wait = TRUE )

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: Process multiple prompts concurrently (synchronous):
code: parallel_chat(   chat_groq,   prompts = list(     "Tell me one fact about Paris.",     "Tell me one fact about Wellington.",     "Tell me one fact about Tokyo."   ) )

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: Groq models: models_groq() Gemini models: ellmer::models_google_gemini()

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: strict structured outputs, Groq supports following models: following models support strict: true, uses constrained decoding guarantee schema-compliant output: following models support Structured Outputs strict: false (default), attempts schema compliance may occasionally error: Streaming tool use currently supported Structured Outputs Groq.

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: batch processing, Groq supports following models: Pricing 50% cost discount compared synchronous API pricing. batch discount stack prompt caching discounts; batch tokens billed 50% batch rate regardless cache status.

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: Gemini batch processing uses file-based Batch API: Requests uploaded JSONL input file, submitted via batchGenerateContent. Processing asynchronous 50% standard pricing target 24-hour turnaround. Maximum input file size: 2 GB. Batch jobs expire 48 hours completed. Context caching supported batch requests (cache hits billed standard cache pricing). Use chat_gemini_extended() create Gemini chat object batch support, pass batch_chat() batch_chat_structured(). Use batch_chat_completed() check whether previously submitted batch finished. following Gemini models support Batch API: Use ellmer::models_google_gemini() full model listing.

title: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer
text: MIT package mostly coded Claude Code, though everything reviewed Xavier Marquez, including live tests.

what: Gemini Provider with Batch API Support — ProviderGeminiExtended
title: Gemini Provider with Batch API Support — ProviderGeminiExtended
text: Internal S7 class extends ellmer::ProviderGoogleGemini file-based batch support batch_chat() batch_chat_structured().

title: Gemini Provider with Batch API Support — ProviderGeminiExtended
code: ProviderGeminiExtended(   name = stop("Required"),   model = stop("Required"),   base_url = stop("Required"),   params = list(),   extra_args = list(),   extra_headers = character(0),   credentials = function() NULL )

title: Groq Developer Provider Class — ProviderGroqDeveloper
text: S7 class extends ProviderOpenAICompatible provide Groq-specific functionality. Inherits capabilities ProviderOpenAICompatible (uses Chat Completions API format) ensuring proper schema formatting Groq's strict JSON validation.

title: Groq Developer Provider Class — ProviderGroqDeveloper
code: ProviderGroqDeveloper(   name = stop("Required"),   model = stop("Required"),   base_url = stop("Required"),   params = list(),   extra_args = list(),   extra_headers = character(0),   credentials = function() NULL )

title: Groq Developer Provider Class — ProviderGroqDeveloper
text: name Provider name model Model identifier (e.g., "openai/gpt-oss-20b") base_url API base URL params Parameters list generation control extra_args Additional API arguments extra_headers Additional HTTP headers credentials API credentials (function string)

title: Groq Developer Provider Class — ProviderGroqDeveloper
text: class also implements batch processing support via Groq's Batch API, offers 50% cost discount compared synchronous API calls. Users typically use chat_groq_developer() instead calling constructor directly. class exported advanced use cases.

what: Chat with Gemini Models (Extended Batch Support) — chat_gemini_extended
title: Chat with Gemini Models (Extended Batch Support) — chat_gemini_extended
text: Creates chat interface Google's Gemini API support asynchronous file-based batch processing batch_chat() batch_chat_structured(). constructor mirrors ellmer::chat_google_gemini() using provider subclass implements batch methods required ellmer.

title: Chat with Gemini Models (Extended Batch Support) — chat_gemini_extended
code: chat_gemini_extended(   system_prompt = NULL,   base_url = "https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/",   api_key = NULL,   credentials = NULL,   model = NULL,   params = NULL,   api_args = list(),   api_headers = character(),   echo = NULL )

title: Chat with Gemini Models (Extended Batch Support) — chat_gemini_extended
text: system_prompt system prompt set behavior assistant. base_url Base URL Gemini API. api_key Use credentials instead. credentials Override default credentials. generally need argument; instead set GEMINI_API_KEY (GOOGLE_API_KEY) .Renviron. model model use chat (defaults "gemini-2.5-flash"). params Common model parameters, usually created ellmer::params(). api_args Additional arguments passed API. api_headers Additional HTTP headers. echo Whether echo conversation console.

title: Chat with Gemini Models (Extended Batch Support) — chat_gemini_extended
text: ellmer::Chat object Gemini support : $chat() $chat_structured() batch_chat() batch_chat_structured()

what: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
text: Creates chat interface Groq's API support structured outputs, batch processing, parallel execution. developer version extends ellmer's ProviderOpenAICompatible inherit full batch support adding Groq-specific schema formatting (additionalProperties: false). Sign https://groq.com. Built top ellmer's ProviderOpenAICompatible class.

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
code: chat_groq_developer(   system_prompt = NULL,   base_url = "https://api.groq.com/openai/v1",   api_key = NULL,   credentials = NULL,   model = NULL,   params = NULL,   api_args = list(),   echo = NULL,   api_headers = character() )

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
text: system_prompt system prompt set behavior assistant. base_url Base URL Groq API. api_key Use credentials instead. credentials Override default credentials. generally need argument; instead set GROQ_API_KEY environment variable. best place set .Renviron, can easily edit calling usethis::edit_r_environ(). need additional control, argument takes zero-argument function returns either string (API key), named list (added additional headers every request). model model use chat (defaults "openai/gpt-oss-20b"). regularly update default, strongly recommend explicitly specifying model anything casual use. Use models_groq() see options. params Common model parameters, usually created ellmer::params(). api_args Additional arguments passed API. echo Whether echo conversation console. One : "none": output "output": Echo assistant responses "": Echo messages Defaults "output" interactive sessions, "none" otherwise. api_headers Additional HTTP headers.

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
text: ellmer::Chat object methods : $chat(): Send messages receive responses $chat_structured(): Extract structured data type validation Batch processing via batch_chat() batch_chat_structured() Parallel processing via parallel_chat() parallel_chat_structured()

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
text: Groq supports strict JSON schema validation guaranteed compliance using compatible models. See https://console.groq.com/docs/structured-outputs details.

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
text: Groq's batch API offers 50% cost discount rate limit impact. Batch jobs processed asynchronously completion windows 24 hours 7 days. Use batch_chat() batch_chat_structured() submit batches. See https://console.groq.com/docs/batch details.

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
text: strict structured output support, use: "openai/gpt-oss-20b" (default) "openai/gpt-oss-120b" models support best-effort JSON output may guarantee schema compliance.

title: Chat with Groq AI Models (Developer Version) — chat_groq_developer
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic chat chat <- chat_groq_developer() chat$chat("What is the capital of France?")  # Structured output type_person <- ellmer::type_object(   name = ellmer::type_string(),   age = ellmer::type_integer(),   city = ellmer::type_string() ) result <- chat$chat_structured(   "John is 30 years old and lives in NYC",   type = type_person )  # Batch processing results <- batch_chat(   chat,   prompts = c("Question 1?", "Question 2?", "Question 3?") )  # Parallel processing results <- parallel_chat(   chat,   prompts = c("Question 1?", "Question 2?", "Question 3?") ) } # }

what: ellmer.extensions: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer — ellmer.extensions-package
title: ellmer.extensions: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer — ellmer.extensions-package
text: Provides ellmer provider extensions full support Groq structured outputs, batch processing, parallel execution, plus Gemini file-based batch chat support. Extends ellmer provider classes add provider-specific batch semantics compatibility behaviors.

title: ellmer.extensions: Groq and Gemini Provider Extensions for ellmer — ellmer.extensions-package
text: Maintainer: Xavier Marquez marquez.x@gmail.com

title: List Available Groq Models — models_groq
text: Retrieves list available models Groq API. Returns model metadata including context window size active status.

title: List Available Groq Models — models_groq
code: models_groq(   base_url = "https://api.groq.com/openai/v1",   api_key = NULL,   credentials = NULL )

title: List Available Groq Models — models_groq
text: base_url Base URL Groq API. api_key Use credentials instead. credentials Override default credentials. generally need argument; instead set GROQ_API_KEY environment variable.

title: List Available Groq Models — models_groq
text: data frame columns: id Model identifier (e.g., "llama-3.3-70b-versatile") created_at Date model created owned_by Organization owns/provides model context_window Maximum context window size tokens active Whether model currently active/available

title: List Available Groq Models — models_groq
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all available models models <- models_groq() print(models)  # Filter for active models with large context windows large_context <- models[models$context_window >= 32768 & models$active, ] } # }
